lines.text: Digital Democracy 2030
>What is Digital Democracy 2030?

> "Digital Democracy 2030" is a project that aims to evolve politics for the better by harnessing the voice of citizens through the power of technology. With an emphasis on transparency and trust, we aim for a future in which many people can participate in policy making.
[Digital Democracy 2030 https://dd2030.org/]
[digital democracy]
[public information AI]
[Large-scale deliberation support system "Idobata]
2025-05-07 Management structure changed with the launch of [Takahiro Yasuno]'s new party "[Team Mirai]".
[Digital Democracy 2030, New Board Structure｜Digital Democracy 2030 https://note.com/dd2030/n/n27f77452ef49]
[https://www.youtube.com/live/hlfQBK5dcUU]
Press conference held by [Takahiro Yasuno] on 2025-01-16

Official Note article: [Full transcript of the press conference of Takahiro Yasuno launching the AI project "Digital Democracy 2030"｜#Takahiro Yasuno Office (official) https://note.com/annotakahiro24/n/nfd4a855cd1a8]

>[takahiroanno https://x.com/takahiroanno/status/1901567413671608647] We just open-sourced yesterday the Digital Democracy 2030 related software we were working on as a team, and we are very grateful for the many PRs we have received. We are very grateful for the many PRs we have received (I counted, about 10 PRs have already been merged by non-members of the original team...!)
> [https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GmO5BVAboAABxmg?format=jpg&name=medium#.png]
Slack has over 250 users within a day of the release of [public information AI] and [Large-scale deliberation support system "Idobata"], and improvements are in progress.
2025-03-16 2 projects OSS open to the public
>[takahiroanno https://x.com/takahiroanno/status/1901176284077867218] Repository for "Broadband AI" is now available as part of the Digital Democracy 2030 project.
> We are working to improve the functionality of the system to match the practices of Japanese local governments and politicians, with reference to Talk to the City.
>[takahiroanno https://x.com/takahiroanno/status/1901193771351494930] [Repository Publication]
> To continue, as part of the Digital Democracy 2030 project, we have released the repository of the large-scale deliberation support system "Idobata".
2025-03-13 Slack Open

>[takahiroanno https://x.com/takahiroanno/status/1900073162370658464] We have set up a Slack for the development and user group of Digital Democracy 2030! If you are interested in joining the group, please click the following URL to join!

>[takahiroanno https://x.com/takahiroanno/status/1900073164006449418] We apologize for the delay in replying to those who have contacted us individually via the form. We will make an announcement to those who have contacted us in due course.
> We have a lot of things ready to go, and I think it will be time to make the repository public...!
>[takahiroanno https://x.com/takahiroanno/status/1899046608559587373] [New initiative
> "Tokyo AI Strategy Idobata Conference" website is now available!
> …https://large-scale-conversation-sandbox.discourse.group/t/topic/39

> This is a discussion forum that I have set up on my own to deepen my thoughts on the issues of the "Tokyo AI Strategy Council", of which I am a member. I will be participating in the conference, referring to the discussions here, so if you are interested in AI strategy of local governments, please do not hesitate to join!
Responses observed by 2025-01-31
[Interview with Takahiro Yasuno! Digital Democracy] (KDP)
[Minister Hirai Digital talks about Mr. Yasuno]
Responses observed by 2025-01-18
Kakuya Haruha, Secretary General of the National Democratic Party of Japan, Member of the House of Councillors

>[SHIMBA_OFFICE https://x.com/SHIMBA_OFFICE/status/1879781429602922608] I listened to Takahiro Yasuno's conference on the launch of "AI Project Digital Democracy 2030". Some words were difficult for me as an analog person, but Ms. Takae Ito chewed them up and taught them to me!

> The Taiwanese government's "Join" system, which allows anyone to raise issues on the Web and requires that policies that receive more than 5,000 endorsements within 60 days will be considered, is exactly what we were aiming for.

> We need politics now that does not look only at the people in front of us. We are the voice on the streets, traveling the country. Live voices by phone, email, social networking and YouTube live. We are listening to the voices of the voiceless through broadband listening. We want to create policies by listening to the voices of the voiceless.
> I'm excited! (Kevin's story)
Takae Ito (Member of the House of Councillors, Democratic Party of Japan)
>[itotakae0630 https://x.com/itotakae0630/status/1879782763781648408] one second after the conference.
> How can this be utilized in the National Democratic Party's policy making process, I have been instructed to review this in a day and a half. Kevin, you are a people person.
Yuichiro Tamaki (Democratic Party of Japan)

>[tamakiyuichiro https://x.com/tamakiyuichiro/status/1879812625439363181] If we can create a system that gathers the wisdom and power of all citizens to create policies and laws, democracy will be restarted.
> I think this project will not only help some loud voices, but also make visible voices that have been difficult to visualize.
> I think this will be a very NDP-like initiative, so let's do it.
> Let's create new answers together!
Hirofumi Yoshimura, Governor of Osaka Prefecture, Representative of Japan Restoration Association

>[hiroyoshimura https://x.com/hiroyoshimura/status/1879824020406964591] I like Mr. Yasuno's "AI Project Digital Democracy 2030". We will actually use it in Japan Restoration Association. Broad listening and AI will be utilized for better policies. First, we will target "reforms to lower social insurance premiums and social security reforms" and use the AI system to reflect numerous ideas and voices in our policies. Execution.
Kiyomi Tsujimoto. Member of the House of Councillors. Acting representative of the Democratic Party of Japan.
>[tsujimotokiyomi https://x.com/tsujimotokiyomi/status/1879875398491865211] I would like to work with Takahiro Yasuno's "Digital Democracy 2030", a demonstration experiment.
>[takahiroanno https://x.com/takahiroanno/status/1879346249616503195] Press conference tomorrow!
> [https://gyazo.com/67cf9c88514b5cecd303d7d53eef4b7c]
[digital democracy]

>[nishio https://x.com/nishio/status/1880922534558007468] Three opposition parties have already publicly declared their participation in the digital democracy initiative presented at Anno-san’s press conference. Some politicians are suggesting that this could be a key factor leading to a change in government.

>[nishio https://x.com/nishio/status/1880922722307559909] Personally, I am not directly interested in ending the LDP administration. If all major parties support digital democracy, Japan will move forward regardless of which party holds power. I think Anno-san’s strategy, akin to a Lagrange point, is truly brilliant.
[Digital Democracy 2030]

Team Mirai
[Team Mirai｜Technology for a Japan where no one is left behind https://team-mir.ai/]
[[Original] AI Engineer Takahiro Yasuno Launches New Party "Team Mirai" for Upper House Election, Yasuno to Run for Proportional Representation (Published on May 7, 2025) e4cae078768af585891]

>[nishio https://x.com/nishio/status/1919947239188733988] AI engineer Takahiro Anno, a former Tokyo gubernatorial candidate, is launching the new party “Team Mirai” for this summer’s Upper House election. He’ll run on the proportional list with a vision of tech-driven inclusion. Press conference set for 8 May.

> AI engineer Takahiro Yasuno, former Tokyo gubernatorial candidate, is launching a new party, Team Mirai, for this summer's Upper House election. He will be on the proportional list with a vision of technology-driven inclusion. A press conference is scheduled for May 8.

>[nishio https://x.com/nishio/status/1919948704691454219] Mirai=Future. Team Mirai pledges a Japan where no one is left behind by technology. Their headline promise: funnel public party subsidies into an engineering hub inside the Diet, injecting practical software expertise into policy. More candidates to follow alongside Anno.

> Mirai=Future. Team Mirai pledges a Japan where no one is left behind by technology. Their headline promise is to pour public party subsidies into engineering hubs within the Diet and inject practical software expertise into policy. More candidates will follow suit alongside Yasuno.

This page is auto-translated from [/nishio/チームみらい] using DeepL. [https://gyazo.com/6a36c13ab68124a46cd6b8dc18602606]
I have to clean up the tabs.
[List of articles you might want to write]
Criticism based on not being perfect
Most of them are not perfect and are easy criticisms that can be used at any time.
Criticism with excessive abstraction
False dichotomy
[People who come in and cause problems and ban are not "left behind".]
[Just saying it's a problem is not a solution.]
If it's zero-sum, changing something means someone else loses money.
Loss does not equal death.
100 days ago [Diary 2025-03-15].
1 year ago [Diary 2024-06-23].

OpenRouter fallback
[nishio.icon]Too puzzling.
The code calling o1 in OpenRouter returns a summary that follows the freshshot example when executed locally, but for some reason it does not follow it at all when executed in GitHub Actions...
[o3.icon]OpenRouter auto-routing/fallback - Actions When a runner IP hits a rate limit, o1 falls back to another provider or an older version and the inference policy changes.
Probably a lie.

pages.title: Rinoro attack (assassination attempt on Prince Regent Hirohito, Dec. 27, 1923)

lines.text: Rinoro attack (assassination attempt on Prince Regent Hirohito, Dec. 27, 1923)
[Rina Kuroiwa] (wife of [Takahiro Yasuno])
>[rinakuro https://x.com/rinakuro/status/1937117099371139529] I was just on the street at night when a stranger asked me if I was Yasuno's wife,
> "You racist!　Nazi!　Murderer!" and pushed me...
> The injury was not serious, but it was indeed scary...
>[rinakuro https://x.com/rinakuro/status/1937117686351482913] In the meantime, I went to the police and filed a damage report, but that's too scary indeed...

> But "racist" is a crazy strong word... of course, resorting to violence is out of the question, but seriously, I'm not sure it's the same word you can throw at others online... well, you say "legitimate criticism". ...

>[rinakuro https://x.com/rinakuro/status/1937128212863258900] It's a risky thing to pursue a career in politics, including for family members (I've never experienced violence like this, but it's normal to be abused on the street, etc.). (As you can imagine, this is the first time I have ever experienced such a violent incident,)
> It's pretty harsh when people say things like "Anno isn't serious about politics, he's just playing with the elites.

>[nishio https://x.com/nishio/status/1937176183747367096] Violence is not good. And the act of casually throwing around the slander "racist/Nazi/murderer" over the internet also creates a bunch of people who mistakenly believe that their voices are right, which causes violent incidents like this. I wish everyone would imagine the possibility of the world moving in the wrong direction with that one word before posting it.
>[nishio https://x.com/nishio/status/1937177223062224998] I don't think we should live in a world where people who throw slander can destroy evidence at the snap of a finger.
> >riff_sansho: people are indeed too lame to be in a hurry to delete slanderous tweets against Mr. Anno after learning that Mr. Rinoro was attacked by thugs.
> If you have time to fry people, why don't you think about how to improve politics with your own mind?
>[takahiroanno https://x.com/takahiroanno/status/1937127186303271273] This is indeed strange!
>[takahiroanno https://x.com/takahiroanno/status/1937129661903044877] It's as if the family is being harmed.

>[takahiroanno https://x.com/takahiroanno/status/1937730829545013512] A few days ago, my family was assaulted on the street by a man who was verbally abusive in a heartless manner and then pushed away. Such acts of violence cannot be tolerated and I would like to firmly protest against them.

> I take your comments and criticisms of my own words and actions and of the Party's policies very seriously. However, acts that result in physical harm are not acceptable, as they shake the very foundations of democracy.
> In order to protect a society where everyone can feel safe to express their opinions and live in safety, we will take a firm stand against this kind of behavior.

This page is auto-translated from [/nishio/りなくろ襲撃事件] using DeepL. Digital Democracy 2030 and Team Mirai
Brief summary of the discussion about the confusion between [Digital Democracy 2030] and [Team Mirai].
Year 2025
Jan: [Takahiro Yasuno] and [Ken Suzuki] launch the Digital Democracy 2030 project.
March: Program developed by [Yasuno's team] released as open source
May: Yasuno launches [Team Mirai] and leaves the management of Digital Democracy 2030.
source
2025-01-16 "Digital Democracy 2030" Press Conference [Digital Democracy 2030#67871f1faff09e000081022f].
2025-03-13 Slack open / 2025-03-16 "[IIDOBATA system]" and "[public information AI]" OSS open [Digital Democracy 2030#67f515f000000000000087ffab]
2025-05-07 [Team Mirai] launched / structure changed accordingly: [Digital Democracy 2030, New Board Structure｜Digital Democracy 2030 https://note.com/dd2030/n/n27f77452ef49]

pages.title: Audrey Tan x Sakana AI Ito Ren

lines.text: Audrey Tan x Sakana AI Ito Ren
[Audrey Tan x Sakana AI Ito Ren "Plurality" Opens Up the Future of Asian-Style Technology | Forbes JAPAN Official Website (Forbes Japan) https://forbesjapan.com/articles/detail/76284]
[Audrey Tan] × [Sakana AI] [Ren Ito]

This page is auto-translated from [/nishio/オードリー・タン×Sakana AI伊藤錬] using DeepL. If you looks something interesting but the auto-translated English is not good enough to understand it, feel free to let me know at [@nishio_en https://twitter.com/nishio_en]. I'm very happy to spread my thought to non-Japanese readers.
Audrey Tang & David Ha(Sakana AI)
>[nishio https://x.com/nishio/status/1927211381842960393] It's interesting that the listeners are very knowledgeable about the technology, so there's always a different angle to the story.

> [Audrey Tan & Sakana AI David Hur, CEO of Sakana AI, talk about confronting Singularity What "Plurality" will bring: SusHi Tech Tokyo 2025 - ITmedia AI+ https://www.itmedia.co.jp/aiplus/ articles/2505/16/news071.html]
>[mariroom https://x.com/mariroom/status/1920771341353156743] With Audrey Tang & David Ha(Sakana AI) 、
> [SusHI TECH Tokyo 2025] Speaker Finished/
> Audrey Tan & David Ha (Sakana AI) with
> SusHI TECH Tokyo 2025 has finished its presentation/.
> The session I attended with Audrey Tang and David Ha of Sakana AI was very meaningful.

> It was a very stimulating and thought-provoking experience to deepen our discussion on the possibilities of Digital Public Goods and co-evolution with AI based on the idea of "Plurality" advocated by Mr. Audrey.
> "Plurality" instead of "Singularity".
> Toward a society where each individual's "Voice & Choice" is respected,
> The session strongly made me want to share and implement this idea with even more people. We all want to create a wonderful movement that we can spread from Asia!
> It was a truly meaningful experience to join a session with Audrey Tang and David Ha from Sakana AI.
> It was truly a meaningful experience to participate in the session with Audrey Tang and David Ha of Sakana AI.
> Centered around Audrey’s philosophy of Plurality, we explored the future of Digital Public Goods and how AI can evolve in alignment with democratic values.
> Engaging in this dialogue with David from one of the most exciting AI companies today made the discussion especially insightful and forward-looking.
> Audrey's philosophy of "plurality" was the centerpiece of our exploration of the future of digital public goods and how AI can evolve in line with democratic values.
> The discussion was especially insightful and positive as I participated in a conversation with David, one of the most exciting AI companies today.
> Not Singularity, but Plurality.
> Toward a society where each individual’s Voice & Choice is valued and empowered.
> This session reaffirmed my commitment to spreading and implementing this vision in the world.
> Plurality, not singularity.
> Toward a society where each individual's voice and choices are valued and empowered.
> This session reaffirmed my commitment to promote and implement this vision worldwide.
> @audreyt
> @SakanaAILabs
>  #SushiTech
> [https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GqfzWYxXgAEp0O4?format=jpg&name=900x900#.png] [https://pbs.twimg.com/media/GqfzWYMbcAQJxj5?format=jpg&name=900x900#.png]
[Audrey Tang] & [David Ha]([Sakana AI])

pages.title: Purpose-oriented organizations grow out of communities.

lines.text: Purpose-oriented organizations grow out of communities.
Purpose-oriented organizations grow out of communities.
at this time
Community boundaries are bumped up against, hindering the growth of Purpose Oriented Organizations
or
People are brought into the community to meet the needs of the purpose-oriented organization, and members who do not agree on the purpose are dissatisfied.
